name: Lentil Soup
instructions: Rinse lentils under cold water.
In a large pot, sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, cumin, paprika, bay leaf, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf and serve.

name: Quinoa Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cut the tops off the peppers and remove seeds.
In a large bowl, mix quinoa, black beans, corn, onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each pepper with the quinoa mixture.
Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake for 30 minutes, then remove foil.
Top with cheese if desired and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve warm.

name: Vegan Chickpea Curry
instructions: In a large pot, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until softened.
Add curry powder, turmeric, cumin, and paprika, and cook for 1 minute.
Add chickpeas, diced tomatoes, and coconut milk.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve over rice or with naan bread.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Add riced cauliflower and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add peas and carrots, and cook until heated through.
If using eggs, push the cauliflower mixture to one side of the skillet and pour beaten eggs on the other side. Scramble the eggs and mix them with the cauliflower.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil.
Garnish with green onions and serve.

name: Vegetarian Fajitas
ingredients: Optional toppings: sour cream, salsa, guacamole, shredded cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss bell peppers, onion, and zucchini with olive oil, chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast for 20-25 minutes or until tender.
Serve with warm tortillas and desired toppings.

name: Vegan Pesto Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a food processor, combine basil, pine nuts, garlic, olive oil, nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper. Process until smooth.
Drain pasta and return to pot.
Stir in pesto sauce and cherry tomatoes.
Serve warm or cold.
